newsitem.title: POLAND: ZLOTY UNCHANGED VS CURRENCY BASKET, DEPOS EASE.
newsitem.headline: ZLOTY UNCHANGED VS CURRENCY BASKET, DEPOS EASE.

text.p: The Polish zloty finished an active Wednesday session unchanged against the basket of currencies as late foreign currency sell orders neutralised an early zloty slip against the basket, dealers said.
They said foreigners used the zloty's morning dip, caused by banks extending positions after reducing them on Wednesday, to buy zloty debt instruments at a discount.
"There was some late currency selling done by foreigners entering zloty instruments," said Tomasz Nowakowski, forex dealer at Bank Handlowy SA.

The zloty closed flat at 3.02/2.98 percent from the trading band centre, flat from Wednesday's 3.01/2.98 percent. It was at 3.0690/00 to the dollar, down from 3.0673/85 on Wednesday and at 1.8365/73 to the mark, down from 1.8350/55.
One-day depos, which slightly eased during the day, were seen inching up on Friday as the central bank sold 400 million zlotys of 182-day and 400 million of 273-day NBP-bills.
Overnight deposit rates were at 22.30/22.60 percent, down from 22.45/22.65 percent at opening, tomorrow/next rates were at 22.35/22.70 percent, down from opening's 22.45/22.70.
The NBP kept the average yield of its 182-day and 273-day NBP-bills flat at 22.00 pct on Thursday reinforcing market expectations of a possible interest rate cut later this year.
"We may expect interest rate may go down in the longer run, as the NBP did not increase longer NBP-bills yields together with its 91-day paper," said Anna Biernat from BRE SA.
The central bank increased the average yield of its 91-day NBP-bills by 0.15 to 22.15 percent on March 25 after raising the maximum reverse repo rate to 22.15 from 21.65 percent.
Players said the upward pressure on T-bill yields may cool as a result of the central bank's move to cap longer term NBP-bill yields.
